comments:

look at the .log file, included below.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44735 ***

This bug got resolved as a dup of 44735.  44735 got resolved as invalid due to
something related to NFS.  My problem occurred while running on a local
filesystem with no NFS systems in use.

Rick, could you please run with startup.jar and boot.jar available in bug 44735?

This way, we should get a better description of the problem you are facing. Thanks.

Rafael,

I grabbed and installed the startup and boot jars.  Here is the .log file:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Oct 18, 2003 11:51:32.843
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.OSGiBootLoader
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootLoader(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Unknown Source)

Note that this was running under Sun's 1.4.0_03.  

I was able to get it running with 1.4.2 before downloading the startup and boot
jars.  Now under 1.4.2 I get the same error as above that I got with 1.4.0_03.

The launcher is not finding the classes in the boot.jar. Some reasons for that
to happen:
a) there is no boot.jar in <ECLIPSE_HOME>/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot_3.0.0

b) the boot.jar is there but is corrupted (you should be able to check that with:
<JDK_HOME>/bin/jar t <ECLIPSE_HOME>/plugins/org.eclipse.core.boot_3.0.0/boot.jar

If so, you should try to download that JAR again.

Just to be clear: by "download that JAR" I meant the boot.jar available in bug
44735. Thanks.

Rick, were you able to download and try again? The JARs have been used by other
user with no problem, so I believe they are ok.

Rafeal, sorry I took so long.  I didn't want to screw up my work installation so
I had to try it at home.  Yes, the same problem seems to exist as before.  I
downloaded both the startup.jar and boot.jar and placed them in their
appropriate directories.

Here is the .log file
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Oct 28, 2003 23:07:52.12

Only if I use 1.4.2_02 (not 1.4.0_03 as I was trying to) and revert back to the
original startup and boot jars will eclipse start.

Rick - I see you are successfully using RC1 (from other reports).  Am closing 
this problem report(and say that it now works).  Please reopen if I 
misdiagnosed the situation (and there is no appropriate defect open), with the 
associated problem in RC1 or later.  Thanks.
